alert.note: Alert for Brown (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 06 at 9:10PM CDT until May 06 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Brown County in west central Texas... * Until 1100 PM CDT. * At 909 PM CDT, a nearly stationary severe storms was over Brookesmith. Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Camp Bowie, Brookesmith, Winchell, Zephyr and Indian Creek. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... CR 201 crossing Clear Creek, County Road 201 crossing Clear Creek and crossings along County Road 228. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
